title: Payroll software company Ascender invites bank pitches
text:
Technology sector private equity firm Potentia Capital has lobbed another name into the 2020 deal pipeline.

It is understood Potentia sent a request for proposal for its payroll and HR software company Ascender to a handful of bulge bracket investment banks late last week, inviting them to pitch for sell-side roles as the private equity firm mulls an exit or partial exit.

The RFP is said to make it clear Potentia is willing to consider all options for Ascender, although the type of bankers working on it suggests that an initial public offering is the more likely exit outcome.

Investment bankers have started putting pitches together for payroll software company Ascender. Jessica Shapiro

Ascender was said to be pitched as a big player in the local payroll software sector, with more than $100 million a year revenue and strong growth since the Potentia consortium took control in 2015.

Bankers are known to be mulling their pitch, trying to work out what best to compare the company to and which investors would want to buy it. There has been no shortage of software companies heading to the ASX-boards in the past two years, including education and employment sector name ReadyTech which is trading at 6.5-times historical revenue.
